subject: science
description: Science curriculum for grades 3 through 8, aligned with NGSS standards

3.overview: Third grade science explores life science, weather, and forces through hands-on investigation.
3.vocabulary_level: Use simple scientific terms with clear definitions. Relate concepts to everyday experiences.
3.difficulty_guidelines: Focus on observation and description. Simple cause-effect relationships. Concrete examples only.

topics.name: Life Cycles
standards: Describe life cycles of different organisms
Compare life cycles of plants and animals
Understand that organisms have unique life cycles

topics.name: Traits and Inheritance
standards: Recognize that organisms inherit traits from parents
Understand that some traits are influenced by environment
Identify similarities and differences in related organisms

topics.name: Weather and Climate
standards: Describe weather conditions using data
Identify typical weather patterns in different regions
Understand that scientists predict weather using patterns

topics.name: Forces and Motion
standards: Describe patterns of motion
Understand that forces cause changes in motion
Predict motion based on forces applied

4.overview: Fourth grade investigates energy, waves, Earth's features, and how organisms survive in their environments.
4.difficulty_guidelines: Introduce energy transfers. Pattern recognition in earth and life science. Simple data analysis.

topics.name: Energy Transfer
standards: Describe energy transfer between objects
Identify different forms of energy
Explain energy transformation in simple systems

topics.name: Waves and Information
standards: Understand waves transfer energy without matter
Describe properties of waves using patterns
Explain how waves are used to communicate

topics.name: Earth's Features
standards: Describe patterns in rock formations
Understand how wind and water change Earth's surface
Identify evidence of past environments from fossils

topics.name: Structure and Function in Living Things
standards: Describe how internal and external structures support survival
Explain how animals use senses to get information
Understand plant and animal adaptations

5.overview: Fifth grade explores matter, ecosystems, Earth's systems, and the solar system.
5.difficulty_guidelines: Particle model of matter. System interactions. Data analysis and modeling.

topics.name: Matter and Its Interactions
standards: Describe that matter is made of particles too small to see
Measure and graph to identify materials by properties
Demonstrate that matter is conserved in chemical reactions

topics.name: Energy and Matter
standards: Use models to describe energy in food
Explain matter cycles through ecosystems
Understand that energy flows through ecosystems

topics.name: Earth's Systems
standards: Describe the water cycle
Explain how Earth's major systems interact
Describe how communities use science to protect resources

topics.name: Space Systems
standards: Explain patterns of stars in the night sky
Describe Earth's orbit and its effects
Explain how gravity affects objects in space

6.overview: Sixth grade focuses on cells, body systems, weather patterns, and Earth's history.
6.difficulty_guidelines: Cellular biology introduction. Weather system analysis. Geological time concepts.

topics.name: Cells and Organisms
standards: All living things are made of cells
Cells carry out functions that support life
Organisms are made of cells with specialized functions

topics.name: Body Systems
standards: Describe how body systems interact
Explain how organs work together
Understand that the body responds to external factors

topics.name: Weather and Climate
standards: Explain how unequal heating causes weather patterns
Analyze data to predict weather
Understand factors that affect regional climate

topics.name: Earth's History
standards: Interpret rock layers to understand Earth's history
Analyze fossil distribution for past environments
Understand tectonic processes shape Earth's surface

7.overview: Seventh grade examines ecosystems, genetics, chemical reactions, and Earth's resources.
7.difficulty_guidelines: Genetic inheritance patterns. Chemical equations basics. System modeling and analysis.

topics.name: Ecosystems
standards: Analyze interactions between organisms and environment
Explain how matter cycles through ecosystems
Evaluate impacts of changes in ecosystems

topics.name: Genetics and Heredity
standards: Explain how traits are passed from parents to offspring
Describe how genetic variations arise
Understand environmental factors can affect gene expression

topics.name: Chemical Reactions
standards: Identify evidence of chemical reactions
Explain that atoms are conserved in reactions
Analyze factors that affect reaction rates

topics.name: Earth's Resources
standards: Explain how resources form from geological processes
Evaluate impacts of resource extraction
Propose solutions for sustainable resource use

8.overview: Eighth grade explores forces and motion, energy systems, waves, and evolution.
8.difficulty_guidelines: Newton's laws applications. Energy calculations. Evolution evidence analysis. Wave mathematics.

topics.name: Forces and Motion
standards: Apply Newton's laws to predict motion
Plan investigations on force and motion relationships
Analyze data relating force, mass, and acceleration

topics.name: Energy
standards: Calculate kinetic energy of moving objects
Describe potential energy in various systems
Explain energy transformations and conservation

topics.name: Waves and Electromagnetic Radiation
standards: Use mathematical representations of wave properties
Describe electromagnetic spectrum applications
Explain wave interactions with matter

topics.name: Evolution and Natural Selection
standards: Analyze evidence supporting evolution
Explain how natural selection leads to adaptation
Describe how genetic variation affects survival

topics.name: Earth and Human Activity
standards: Analyze human impacts on Earth's systems
Evaluate solutions for environmental challenges
Understand relationships between natural hazards and human activity
